question.body: What is the effect of an overproduction of growth hormone in children and in adults?

multiple_choice.choice: It has the same effect of causing excessive growth of all bones in both children and adults.
In children it can cause pituitary dwarfism; in adults it primarily affects the bones of the face, hands and feet.
In children it primarily affects the bones of the face, hands and feet; in adults it can cause excessive proportional growth
In children it can cause excessive proportional growth; in adults it primarily affects the bones of the face, hands and feet.

response.feedback: Incorrect. In children the growth plates of the long bones can still grow so the overproduction of GH results in gigantism. In adults the growth plates of the long bones have calcified and only the short bones of the face, hands and feet can continue to grow resulting in acromegaly.
Incorrect. An under production of GH could cause pituitary dwarfism.

Incorrect. In children the growth plates of the long bones can still grow so the over production of GH results in gigantism. In adults the growth plates of the long bones have calcified and only the short bones of the face, hands and feet can continue to grow resulting in acromegaly.
